intro: Dianthus myrtinervius, commonly known as the myrtle-veined campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. The plant has slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Native to southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Dianthus myrtinervius is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
